dt: {bc}to run into or through as a pointed weapon does {bc}{sx|stab||}
{bc}to enter or thrust into sharply or painfully
{bc}to force or make a way into or through
{bc}to penetrate with the eye or mind {bc}{sx|discern||}
{bc}to penetrate so as to move or touch the emotions of
{bc}to force a way into or through something

pt: {sc}enter{/sc} {sc}penetrate{/sc} {sc}pierce{/sc} {sc}probe{/sc} mean to make way into something. {sc}enter{/sc} is the most general of these and may imply either going in or forcing a way in.
{sc}penetrate{/sc} carries a strong implication of an impelling force or compelling power that achieves entrance.
{sc}pierce{/sc} means an entering or cutting through with a sharp pointed instrument.
{sc}probe{/sc} implies penetration to investigate or explore something hidden from sight or knowledge.

et: Middle English {it}percen{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}percer{/it}, from Vulgar Latin {it}*pertusiare{/it}, from Latin {it}pertusus{/it}, past participle of {it}pertundere{/it} to perforate, from {it}per-{/it} through + {it}tundere{/it} to beat {ma}{mat|per-|}, {mat|contusion|}{/ma}
shortdef: to run into or through as a pointed weapon does : stab
to enter or thrust into sharply or painfully
to make a hole through : perforate
